docs.title: Knowledge Base
docs.text: Welcome to my personal knowledge base for managing projects and learning resources.

docs.title: 🏥 NourishRx
docs.text: Startup project documentation, notes, and tasks.

docs.title: 🚜 Farm E-commerce & Marketing
docs.text: Managing e-commerce and marketing for a local farm.

docs.title: 📊 Accounting & Tax Preparation
docs.text: Learning resources, concepts, and notes for accounting and tax preparation.

docs.title: 💻 Claude Code / Tech Skills
docs.text: Upskilling resources for: - Selenium (web automation) - Appium (mobile automation) - SQL (database queries) - And other tech skills

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
This knowledge base is built with MkDocs and the Material theme.

To view locally: 

mkdocs serve

To build for deployment: 

mkdocs build

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
• Search: Use the search bar at the top to find content across all projects
  • Navigation: Use the sidebar to browse by project or topic
  • Edit: All content is in markdown files in the docs/ directory
  • Version Control: All files are tracked in Git for easy versioning

docs.title: Guide: Adding Context to Your Projects
Quick Start
docs.text: There are three ways to add context to your projects:

docs.title: Option 1: Interactive Script (Easiest)
docs.text:
Run the interactive initialization script:

python3 scripts/init-context.py

This will guide you through adding context for each project with prompts.

docs.title: Option 2: Tell Claude (Recommended)
docs.text:
Just tell Claude what you want to add! For example:

  • "I'm working on NourishRx. We just had a meeting about the MVP features. Add that to the context."
  • "For the farm project, we're using Shopify and our top products are eggs, vegetables, and honey."
  • "I'm learning SQL and I just finished a lesson on JOINs. Update my tech learning context."

Claude will automatically update the context files for you.

docs.title: Option 3: Manual Editing
docs.text: Edit the JSON files directly in context/<project-name>/context.json

docs.title: For NourishRx (Startup Project)
docs.text:
Essential Information: - Current focus: What you're working on right now - Recent activity: What you've done recently - Current tasks: Active work items - Next steps: What's coming up - Key decisions: Important decisions made - Blockers: Things preventing progress - Meeting notes: Important discussions - Contacts: Key people involved

Example: 

{
  "currentFocus": "Building MVP features for beta testing",
  "recentActivity": [
    "Completed user authentication system",
    "Met with potential investors",
    "Designed onboarding flow"
  ],
  "currentTasks": [
    "Implement payment integration",
    "Write user documentation",
    "Prepare beta test plan"
  ],
  "nextSteps": [
    "Launch beta with 10 users",
    "Collect feedback",
    "Iterate on core features"
  ],
  "keyDecisions": [
    "Using Stripe for payments",
    "Focusing on web app first, mobile later"
  ]
}

docs.title: For Farm E-commerce & Marketing
docs.text:
Essential Information: - E-commerce platform: Shopify, WooCommerce, etc. - Products: Key products you're selling - Marketing channels: Social media, email, etc. - Active campaigns: Current marketing efforts - Recent orders: Sales activity - Current focus: What you're working on

Example: 

{
  "currentFocus": "Launching spring vegetable campaign",
  "ecommerce": {
    "platform": "Shopify",
    "products": ["Fresh Eggs", "Organic Vegetables", "Local Honey"],
    "recentOrders": ["Increased orders for spring vegetables"]
  },
  "marketing": {
    "activeCampaigns": ["Spring Vegetable Promotion", "Farmers Market Announcement"],
    "channels": ["Instagram", "Facebook", "Email Newsletter"]
  }
}

docs.title: For Accounting & Tax Learning
docs.text:
Essential Information: - Current topic: What you're learning now - Completed lessons: What you've finished - Current lessons: What you're working on - Key concepts: Important things you've learned - Questions: Things you need to understand - Resources: Courses, books, websites

Example: 

{
  "currentTopic": "Tax Deductions",
  "currentFocus": "Understanding business expense deductions",
  "completedLessons": [
    "Basic Accounting Principles",
    "Income Statements",
    "Balance Sheets"
  ],
  "currentLessons": [
    "Tax Deductions Overview",
    "Business Expense Categories"
  ],
  "keyConcepts": [
    "Ordinary and necessary business expenses",
    "Depreciation methods"
  ],
  "questions": [
    "What's the difference between Section 179 and bonus depreciation?",
    "Can I deduct home office expenses?"
  ]
}

docs.title: For Tech Skills Learning
docs.text:
Essential Information: - Current skill: Which one you're focusing on (Selenium/Appium/SQL) - Learning path status: Progress for each skill - Current lessons: What you're learning - Practice projects: Projects you're working on - Code examples: Snippets you're learning - Questions: Technical questions

Example: 

{
  "currentSkill": "sql",
  "currentFocus": "Learning complex JOINs and subqueries",
  "learningPaths": {
    "sql": {
      "status": "in_progress",
      "currentLesson": "Advanced JOINs",
      "completedLessons": [
        "Basic SELECT statements",
        "WHERE clauses",
        "Simple JOINs"
      ],
      "practiceProjects": [
        "Building a query for customer orders",
        "Analyzing sales data"
      ]
    }
  },
  "codeExamples": [
    "SELECT customers.name, orders.total FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.id = orders.customer_id"
  ],
  "questions": [
    "When should I use LEFT JOIN vs INNER JOIN?",
    "How do I optimize slow queries?"
  ]
}

docs.title: As You Work
docs.text: Claude will automatically update context when you: - Complete tasks - Make decisions - Add notes - Switch focus

docs.title: Manual Updates
docs.text: You can ask Claude to update context: - "I just finished the payment integration for NourishRx, update the context" - "Add 'completed SQL JOINs lesson' to my tech learning context" - "I'm blocked on the farm's Shopify integration, add that to blockers"

docs.title: Regular Reviews
docs.text: Periodically review and update: - Completed tasks → move to completedTasks - Update nextSteps as priorities change - Archive old recentActivity items - Update currentFocus as you switch work

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
1. Start Simple: Just add the basics (current focus, next steps)
  2. Update Regularly: Keep context current as you work
  3. Let Claude Help: Claude can update context automatically
  4. Be Specific: Detailed context helps Claude help you better
  5. Use Session History: Check session-history.md to remember what you did

docs.title: Example Workflow
docs.text:
1. Initialize: Run the script or tell Claude to set up initial context
  2. Start Working: Tell Claude which project you're on
  3. Work Normally: Claude tracks and updates context
  4. Review: Periodically check context files
  5. Update: Add new information as needed

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
Just ask Claude: - "Help me add context for NourishRx" - "What context should I add for the farm project?" - "Update my SQL learning context with what I just learned"

Claude can guide you through adding any context you need!

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This knowledge base can be enhanced with Claude Skills and MCP (Model Context Protocol) to create a dynamic, interactive system that goes beyond static documentation.

docs.title: What are Claude Skills?
docs.text: Claude Skills are reusable packages of instructions and code that enable Claude to perform specialized tasks. You can create custom Skills for each of your projects.

docs.title: 1. NourishRx Skill
docs.text:
• Purpose: Generate business documents, client communications, project updates
  • Features:
  • Brand-consistent content generation
  • Meeting note structuring
  • Task list management
  • Client communication templates

docs.title: 2. Farm E-commerce Skill
docs.text:
• Purpose: Marketing content, product descriptions, campaign planning
  • Features:
  • Product description generation
  • Social media post creation
  • Email campaign templates
  • Sales analysis summaries

docs.title: 3. Accounting Learning Skill
docs.text:
• Purpose: Study assistance, concept explanations, practice problem help
  • Features:
  • Concept explanations
  • Practice problem walkthroughs
  • Study note organization
  • Resource recommendations

docs.title: 4. Tech Skills Learning Skill
docs.text:
• Purpose: Code assistance, debugging help, learning path guidance
  • Features:
  • Code review and suggestions
  • Debugging assistance
  • Learning path recommendations
  • Best practices guidance

docs.title: What is MCP?
docs.text: MCP allows Claude to connect to external tools, databases, and data sources, making your knowledge base dynamic and interactive.

docs.title: For NourishRx
docs.text:
• CRM Integration: Connect to customer data
  • Project Management: Link to task tracking tools
  • Documentation APIs: Auto-sync with project docs

docs.title: For Farm E-commerce
docs.text:
• E-commerce Platform: Connect to Shopify/WooCommerce APIs
  • Analytics: Integrate Google Analytics, sales data
  • Inventory Systems: Real-time inventory updates

docs.title: For Learning Projects
docs.text:
• Code Repositories: Connect to GitHub for code examples
  • Learning Platforms: Integrate with course platforms
  • Practice Sites: Connect to LeetCode, HackerRank APIs

docs.title: For Knowledge Base Itself
docs.text:
• Database Backend: Use MCP to connect MkDocs to a database
  • File System: Enhanced file operations
  • Git Integration: Automated updates and versioning
  • Search Enhancement: Connect to external search APIs

docs.title: Best of Both Worlds
docs.text:
You can combine the static site generator (MkDocs) with MCP for dynamic features:

  1. Static Content: Keep documentation in MkDocs (fast, version-controlled)
  2. Dynamic Data: Use MCP to pull live data when needed
  3. Interactive Features: MCP can update content, query databases, etc.

docs.title: Example Architecture
docs.text:
MkDocs (Static Site)
    ↓
MCP Server Layer
    ↓
External Data Sources
    - Databases
    - APIs
    - File Systems
    - Git Repos

docs.title: Option A: Enhanced MkDocs (Recommended)
docs.text:
• Keep MkDocs for documentation
  • Use MCP for dynamic data queries
  • Create Skills for content generation
  • Pros: Best of both worlds, leverages Claude Code
  • Cons: Requires MCP server setup

docs.title: Option B: Database-Backed with MCP
docs.text:
• Switch to database-backed system
  • Use MCP for all interactions
  • More dynamic but less portable
  • Pros: Fully dynamic, powerful queries
  • Cons: More complex, vendor lock-in risk

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
1. Create Claude Skills for each project
  2. Set up MCP servers for external integrations
  3. Enhance MkDocs with MCP-powered dynamic content
  4. Automate workflows using Skills + MCP

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
• Claude Skills Documentation
  • MCP Specification
  • MCP Servers Directory

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Project Context System allows you to maintain separate context for each project, enabling Claude to understand where you left off and maintain project-specific knowledge when you switch between projects.

docs.title: 1. Context Storage
docs.text: Each project has its own context stored in context/<project-name>/context.json: - Current status and focus - Recent activity - Current and completed tasks - Blockers and next steps - Important notes - Related files

docs.title: 2. Active Project Indicator
docs.text: The context/active-project.txt file indicates which project you're currently working on. Claude reads this file to understand which context to load.

docs.title: 3. Session History
docs.text: Each project has a session-history.md file that tracks your work sessions, helping you pick up where you left off.

docs.title: Switching Projects
docs.text:
Option 1: Manual 

echo "nourishrx" > context/active-project.txt

Option 2: Using Script 

./scripts/switch-project.sh nourishrx

Option 3: Tell Claude Just say: "I'm switching to work on the NourishRx project" and Claude will update the active project file.

docs.title: Viewing Current Context
docs.text:
python3 scripts/load-context.py

Or ask Claude: "What's the current context for my active project?"

docs.title: Updating Context
docs.text:
Claude automatically updates context as you work: - When you complete a task - When you make a decision - When you encounter a blocker - When you add notes

You can also manually update context files, or ask Claude to update them.

docs.title: Project Names
docs.text:
• nourishrx - NourishRx startup project
  • farm - Farm e-commerce & marketing
  • accounting - Accounting & tax learning
  • tech-learning - Tech skills learning (Selenium, Appium, SQL)

docs.title: Context File Structure
docs.text:
Each context.json includes:

{
  "project": "Project Name",
  "lastUpdated": "ISO timestamp",
  "status": "active|paused|completed",
  "currentFocus": "What you're currently working on",
  "recentActivity": ["List of recent actions"],
  "currentTasks": ["Active tasks"],
  "completedTasks": ["Recently completed"],
  "blockers": ["Things blocking progress"],
  "keyDecisions": ["Important decisions made"],
  "nextSteps": ["What to do next"],
  "importantNotes": ["Key information"],
  "relatedFiles": ["Paths to related documentation"]
}

docs.title: Automatic Context Loading
docs.text: When you start a conversation, Claude will: 1. Check context/active-project.txt 2. Load the corresponding context.json 3. Read recent session-history.md 4. Understand your current project state

docs.title: Context-Aware Responses
docs.text: Claude will: - Remember where you left off - Reference recent decisions and notes - Suggest next steps based on context - Update context as you work

docs.title: Example Workflow
docs.text:
1. Switch Project: "I'm working on NourishRx now"
  2. Claude updates active-project.txt

  3. Loads NourishRx context

  4. Work on Project: "Add the meeting notes from today"

  5. Claude understands NourishRx context
  6. Adds notes to appropriate files

  7. Updates context with recent activity

  8. Switch Again: "Let me work on SQL learning"

  9. Claude switches to tech-learning context
  10. Remembers where you were in SQL learning
  11. Continues from that point

docs.title: Benefits
docs.text: ✅ Context Switching: Seamlessly switch between projects ✅ Continuity: Pick up exactly where you left off ✅ Organization: Each project maintains its own state ✅ Claude Awareness: Claude understands which project you're working on ✅ History Tracking: Session history helps remember what you did ✅ Related Files: Quick access to project documentation

docs.title: MCP Integration
docs.text: The context system works with MCP servers: - Filesystem MCP can read/write context files - Claude can automatically update context via MCP - Context can be queried programmatically

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Update Active Project: Always set active project when switching
  2. Let Claude Update: Allow Claude to automatically update context
  3. Review Context: Periodically review context files for accuracy
  4. Session History: Check session history to remember past work
  5. Related Files: Keep related files list updated

docs.title: Templates
docs.text: Useful templates for common documentation needs.

docs.title: Meeting Notes Template
docs.text:
# Meeting Notes - [Date]

## Attendees
- Person 1
- Person 2

## Agenda
1. Topic 1
2. Topic 2

## Discussion
_Key points discussed_

## Decisions
- Decision 1
- Decision 2

## Action Items
- [ ] Action item 1 - Owner: Name
- [ ] Action item 2 - Owner: Name

## Next Steps
_What happens next_

docs.title: Project Update Template
docs.text:
# Project Update - [Date]

## Progress
_What was accomplished_

## Blockers
_What's blocking progress_

## Next Week
_Planned work_

## Questions
_Questions that need answers_

docs.title: Learning Note Template
docs.text:
# [Topic] - [Date]

## What I Learned
_Key takeaways_

## Resources
- Resource 1
- Resource 2

## Practice
_How to practice this_

## Questions
_Questions to explore further_
